answers.answer: No it is not too late for you to switch Dr's.  Call around and see if you can locate a new Dr.  You will need to sign a release so they can get your medical records.   I would also call your current clinic and talk to the clinic manager.

Sorry to hear that you're being treated that way.  And -- it really is your OB who should see you for the swelling and headaches since it is a sign of preeclampsia.It also should NOT be taken lightly -- you need to get in as soon as possible.Call back and DEMAND to speak to the doctor...DEMAND that they see you NOW!Once you get checked out, tell your doctor that you are VERY concerned about how you've been treated.  If he/she is apologetic, make sure he/she speaks to his staff so that you are not treated this way again.  If he's NOT apologetic, then you really may want to find a new doctor.Finding a doctor at this point may be difficult as some may not want to take on someone this far along -- others may have no problem doing so.Do you have any other health issues/complications?  If not, it may be easier for someone to take you -- but you don't know that they won't be just as bad if not worse.I'd start by getting in w/ doc for check, then making him/her aware of the problem and see if you can make it work.Good luck!

I switched at 32 weeks!! I HATED my practice, made me cry all the time. I called w/thoughts of a UTI and they pawned me off to my GP which I didn't have one. She said she doesn't just SEE people for UTI's.....mayabe she would have a nurse call me back. That was it! I said DON'T BOTHER!! UTI's could mean early labor...Ughh. I hate that for you, but , you will find someone that will be happy to take good care of you, I promise..

It sounds like that nurse is the problem.  I would speak directly with the doctor and inform them of this person.  Like wonderme said, if the doctor seems concerned than I would stick with the OB, as long as you don't have to deal with that nurse again.

I don't think you are going to be able to avoid the nurse.  I dislike my pediatrician's nurse, but she does so much with the baby that I am going to have to switch pediatricians entirely if I want to get away from that nurse.  I wouldn't hesitate to switch OBs even at this stage of pregnancy.  Heck, I wouldn't hesitate to switch in my ninth month.  Take care of yourself, the nurse isn't.

question: I'm 29wks pregnant and just recently I've had questions about sudden swelling and headaches.  I called my doctors office and the nurse I talked to spoke to me like I was some kind of idiot.  She told me to go see my family physician.  Ummmm, ok.  So, I tried to get in, but was unable to.  I called my OB Dr. back and left a msg telling them that I couldn't get in.  Nobody called me back.  Come to find out, my husband made a phone call today from Iraq to this office telling them he was concerned about my health and that I'm sad all the time.  This same nurse spoke to my husband like he was an idiot and she acts like she just doesn't care.  I guess my question is..........is it too late for me to switch OB's?  I just don't feel like I'm cared about.
title: 29wks & don't like my OB
